data.text:
@LongDesertTrain @LittleKeesie @elisaperego78 @lisa_iannattone @FranceskoNew @Gab_H_R @DRTomlinsonEP @DocVatsa @NjbBari3 @DMinghella I say it since January 2021...😅
https://t.co/pMTLawS6eZ

@Antonio_Caramia @elisaperego78 @lisa_iannattone @FranceskoNew @Gab_H_R @LongDesertTrain @DRTomlinsonEP @DocVatsa @NjbBari3 @DMinghella Perché gran parte della popolazione, inglese e non, è vaccinata.

@Antonio_Caramia @LongDesertTrain @elisaperego78 @lisa_iannattone @FranceskoNew @Gab_H_R @DRTomlinsonEP @DocVatsa @NjbBari3 @DMinghella Please explain how this graph exists after our omicron wave, if there is no immunity from infection?  Did covid go away...? https://t.co/YWkEIrRPbh

@LittleKeesie @Antonio_Caramia @elisaperego78 @lisa_iannattone @FranceskoNew @Gab_H_R @DRTomlinsonEP @DocVatsa @NjbBari3 @DMinghella Better vaccines would be great—particularly intranasal, IgA-eliciting vaccines—and I think we'll eventually get them. But they seem quite a ways off. There's some encouraging mice data, but NHP trials need to be done before we can even start human trials. 
https://t.co/DvA42vrSEk

@Antonio_Caramia @LongDesertTrain @elisaperego78 @lisa_iannattone @FranceskoNew @Gab_H_R @DRTomlinsonEP @DocVatsa @NjbBari3 @DMinghella Welp, that settles it. You said it on Twitter so it must be true... 🤷‍♂️🙄

@LongDesertTrain @Antonio_Caramia @elisaperego78 @lisa_iannattone @FranceskoNew @Gab_H_R @DRTomlinsonEP @DocVatsa @NjbBari3 @DMinghella I disagree that we would have already seen it. It's unclear if "long lasting" herd immunity is even attainable at this point, given the vaccines that don't prevent infection. Herd immunity comes from a combination of infection and vaccination. Maybe a better vax will help?

@LittleKeesie @Antonio_Caramia @elisaperego78 @lisa_iannattone @FranceskoNew @Gab_H_R @DRTomlinsonEP @DocVatsa @NjbBari3 @DMinghella And though @Antonio_Caramia doesn't say so above, I'll add this: Rampant spread of SARS-CoV-2 makes new, immunity-evading variants inevitable. Early hopes that the emergence of new variants would slow have proven false. Mutational space appears limitless. https://t.co/uFiRbN0MsP

@LittleKeesie @Antonio_Caramia @elisaperego78 @lisa_iannattone @FranceskoNew @Gab_H_R @DRTomlinsonEP @DocVatsa @NjbBari3 @DMinghella If allowing most of the population to be infected could lead to long-lasting herd immunity, we would have already seen it. We haven't seen it. Therefore, mass infection of the population is a terrible strategy with devastating long-term consequences. 2/2

@LittleKeesie @Antonio_Caramia @elisaperego78 @lisa_iannattone @FranceskoNew @Gab_H_R @DRTomlinsonEP @DocVatsa @NjbBari3 @DMinghella Here's my interpretation: Vaccination & infection together have resulted in ~98% of the population having antibodies. We have allowed virtually unmitigated spread of Covid in multiple waves. Yet more deadly & disabling waves keep coming, with no end in sight. 1/2
